DemoDays

Student demos at the intersection of art, design and code.

April 2014

Archival Content • Submit correction

The April 2014 DemoDays was held on 04/26/2014 at The Flatiron School in New York City.

Join us next time!

DemoDays is a monthly student-run event in NYC, organized by tech@NYU, Parsons Code Club, Create@Cooper and Columbia ADI. We're all about fostering a community of students who create things. We want to provide a platform for student builders to present their work, to celebrate their creations, and let that inspire other students to build projects they care about.

  • Wanna show off?

    SIGN UP

  • Wanna hang out?

Demos

  • Oops, we don't have any data for this month yet. If you showed your work at DemoDays April 2014, please submit a correction!

Speaker

Abe Geiger

CTO of Digg

cto of the new http://digg.com news.me founder (@betaworks). former lead technologist at nytimes r&d lab

Digg

Digg delivers the most interesting and talked about stories on the Internet right now. The Internet is full of great stories, and Digg helps you find, read, and share the very best ones. It’s simple and it’s everywhere visit Digg on the web, find it on your iOS or Android device, or get the best of Digg delivered to your inbox with The Daily Digg.

Steve Kaliski

Co-founder of Bowery

building Bowery during the day, punslinger at night.

Bowery

Bowery is a limitless development environment. Does your application need to run on multiple machines? Does it need more computing resources than your laptop has? Are you tired of installing, configuring, and reconfiguring software? Perfect.

DemoDays

tech@NYU in conjunction with create@cooper, Parsons Code Club, and Columbia ADI
